meanings.definition: To grab or seize something quickly or eagerly.
meanings.sent1: She snatched the toy from the shelf.
meanings.sent2: The thief snatched the purse and ran away.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel snatched the nut and scurried up the tree.
meanings.sent4: Time snatched the opportunity before he could act.
meanings.sent5: The wind snatched the hat off her head and carried it away.

meanings.definition: To take something away suddenly or forcefully.
meanings.sent1: The eagle snatched the fish from the water.
meanings.sent2: The bully snatched his lunch money every day.
meanings.sent3: The magician snatched the coin from behind his ear.
meanings.sent4: The storm snatched the umbrella from her hands.
meanings.sent5: The vacuum cleaner snatched the crumbs off the floor.
